columns.text: In this problem, we will solve for the net income of a given company using the concept of DuPont Identity.

Based on the given values, we can first solve for the equity multiplier by simply adding $1$ to the debt-to-equity ratio.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Equity multiplier}&=1+0.57\\[15 pt]
&=1.57
\end{aligned}$$

The equity multiplier that we will use is $1.57$

Next, we can solve for the total asset turnover by taking the sales and dividing it by the total assets.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Total equity turnover}&=\dfrac{\$6,183}{\$2,974}\\[15 pt]
&=2.079
\end{aligned}$$

The total equity turnover for this is $2.079$

Now that we have these necessary values, we can solve for the profit margin using the DuPont identity.

$$\begin{aligned}
0.11&=\text{Profit margin}\times 2.079\times1.57
\end{aligned}$$

Divide both sides by the product of $2.079$ and $1.57$ to get the profit margin.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Profit margin}&=\dfrac{0.11}{2.079 \times 1.57}\\[15 pt]
&=0.0337
\end{aligned}$$

The profit margin that we will use for this is $0.0337$

Now that we have the profit margin, we can simply multiply this to the sales to get the net profit.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Net profit}&=0.0337 \times \$6,183\\[15 pt]
&=\$208.37
\end{aligned}$$

The net profit of the company is $\$208.37$
